vaccines: Hepatitis A vaccination is recommended for most travelers.
Typhoid vaccination is recommended for most travelers.
Consider Rabies vaccination for travelers with increased risk (e.g., rural/long stays).
Consider Cholera vaccine for certain travelers.
malaria: Malaria is a risk in many areas; prophylaxis (atovaquone-proguanil, doxycycline, or mefloquine) may be recommended depending on itinerary.
other_risks: Japanese Encephalitis risk for long stays in rural areas.

vaccines: Hepatitis A recommended for most travelers.
Yellow Fever vaccine recommended/required depending on itinerary and entry rules.
malaria: Malaria risk present in most areas; prophylaxis recommended (atovaquone-proguanil, doxycycline, or mefloquine).

vaccines: Hepatitis A recommended for most travelers.
Yellow Fever vaccine recommended for many areas.
malaria: Malaria risk exists in parts of the Amazon basin; prophylaxis may be recommended depending on itinerary.
other_risks: Dengue, Zika, and Chikungunya occur; avoid mosquito bites.
